website_summaries.verdict: The Logitech Harmony 900 is an impressive universal remote but it loses some of its luster with the release of the Harmony Ultimate, which replaces it in the Harmony line.
pros: Sleek design, in terms of cosmetics and ergonomics
excellent button layout and design that now includes new Blu-ray-centric buttons
high-resolution LCD that offers a touch-screen interface and touch-sensitive buttons for navigation of onscreen menus
rechargeable lithium ion battery and docking station
RF option included--and it's very easy to set up
cons: Price will scare off some buyers
dearth of user-programmable multi-device macros will frustrate advanced users

customer_reviews.title: Great idea if it ever gets to the point where it works
customer_reviews.text: Bought as refurbished. Great physical condition. Powered up and that’s where my positive experience stopped. Would not sync to PC. Tried new cable. Still didn’t sync. Tried different Pc. Same story. Returned it. Cost me $12 to ship back via UPS ground. Very disappointed in entire purchase. Be wary of who you buy this from. If marketplace seller READ THE RETURN POLICY!
customer_reviews.author: WmGoatHuntleyIL

customer_reviews.title: The best but still needs work
customer_reviews.text: Logitech bought Harmony years ago. Since then they continue to "dumb down" the interface and ability to program them as you used to be able to.I have two of these. Each work differently even though they are the same model. One starts up much faster than the other. I cannot program them to perform the exact steps I want due to Logitech's changes to the software. In addition, I can't believe they get away with saying the swollen battery issue is normal! Once they swell, they are nearly impossible to remove without breaking the remote. I have one (different model) that broke the battery door clips off because the batter swelled so much! That's "normal"?
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Burstiner

customer_reviews.title: Will drive you NUTS.
customer_reviews.text: I've used two generations of these horribly overpriced and relentlessly problematic devices. This RF repeater version is better than my old IR repeater configuration in one way, that my components cannot become confused by receiving both direct and indirect IR commands. Setup is difficult and I'd presume a challenge for everyone. Even when it sort of works it often takes a number of button presses. It may be a fundamental problem with devices using "toggle off-on", because components inevitably get out of sync and one needs to work their front panels manually. This thing is not for the faint of heart. Please, someone, design one that works!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The technical assistance is the best I have ever contacted
customer_reviews.text: When I updated the firmware the control stopped working. I contacted them; they apologized and requested my address so they would send me a new one. I didn't have to hurry to send mine because they wanted first to be sure I had my remote working as fast as possible. After I received the new one, working perfectly, I sent them the one defective. The remote is very good - not the fastest one - but a little difficult to configure if you want to include many different items. If you put the basics, like tv, cable, dvd, radio, it configures very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Renato N.

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 900 Rechargeable Remote with Color Touch Screen by Logitech
customer_reviews.text: (No Harmony here!) This is our second Logitech Harmony 900 Rechargeable Remote with Color Touch Screen by Logitech the first one would not set up we tried to set it up for three days with tech assistance. We finally sent it back for a replacement; I wish I had just gotten a refund! This one only works when it wants to! I would not recommend the Logitech Harmony 900 Rechargeable Remote to anyone! We hate this remote most of the time we grab the original Samsung TV remote and/or Direct TV remote! This remote is a HUGE waste of money and is so aggravating it makes us hate to even sit down to watch TV...
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 5 Star device
customer_reviews.text: I've spent hours investigating the right remote for "the laymen" and occasional visitor while still being powerful enough for the super user. When we decide to change a channel, we need hard buttons. Reaction time for hard buttons is just quicker. Screen buttons are sleek and sexy, but sometimes just don't take. I have one of these being used with a Sharp 55" LCD and DirecTV. Works great. Would be nice if it had more memory for more favorite channels. Icons for favorite channels are also available so it looks polished when you take the time to set it up right. Logitech sync software is also pretty sound and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Remote
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote becasue I needed the RF capabilities to command my AV equipment in a closed cabinet. Once you get this set up and with some fine tunining, this remote works great to control many systems in concert. One limitation is that it doesn;t allow you to create your own series of commands, ie a marco. You can do a lot with what they call "Activities" but there are times when you would like to specifically identified a series of commands for one or more devices and this remote can not do that. Technically I'm sure it is capable of it but for some reason, Logitech has opted not to enable it in this version of the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Southwest Florida

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: There are a ton of great features on this remote, but my three favorites are listed below: 1. It works through walls (my components are in a closet in another room around the corner and it still works!) 2. Very user friendly once it's programmed. If something isnt working the remote walks you through a series of troubleshooting problems or gives you the option of fixing it yourself. It's really easy. 3. It's rechargeable. I had a different harmony remote before that burned through batteries so the rechargeable feature saves a ton of money in batteries (and eliminates the hassle).
customer_reviews.author: Callaghan

customer_reviews.title: Harmony 900 differences to Harmony 890
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an 890. Here are key points. Z wave devices are not compatible, so I still have that remote to turn on/off lights. Bottom of remote is curved, so it's "impossible" to press any button if the remote is on a hard flat surface. Range is greatly inferior to the 890, but should be acceptable for most applications. I love the design... button spacing is very good, and every button operates perfectly with one push (my 890 is finicky in this regard). I also love that the remote extender doesn't have to be PC synced anymore. I highly recommend the Harmony 900. My 890 battery immediately swelled (pregnant!), but so far, the 900 battery has retained its shape.
customer_reviews.author: Schluterville

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished and Broken
customer_reviews.text: Bought this remote hoping to gain some wireless control of my components. Shortly after buying it I had issues getting it to consistently take a charge. I contacted Logitech support and was requested for the product ID. After providing the product information I was informed that it was originally activated 03/11 and was out of support. Their recommendation was for me to purchase a new remote and that this issue was resolved. Even assuming that there were no issues with this product, I would be reticent to endorse a company that is unable or unwilling to support their products and instead emphasizes a disposable solution to a several hundred dollar device.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 900 Remote
customer_reviews.text: The remote was difficult for a senior citizen to set-up, but Logitech's technicians were EXCELLENT in helping me program the remote. After they helped with the set-up process and got the remote working properly I would highly recommend this remote! It works and does everything one could expect. I currently have my Bose Sound System, Sony Blu-ray DVD player, multiple Panasonic CD-DVD player, Bose DVD player, FM radio, DISH network and Samsung HD TV working off of this remote. Switching to anyone of these activities works like it should, shutting off one activity and turning on the other with the touch of a finger on the screen. SUPER REMOTE!
customer_reviews.author: MNVikings

customer_reviews.title: Great remote; just wish it wasn't so expensive!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this remote now for about a month and I LOVE it! It's very easy to set up and use, and I have absolutely no complaints whatsoever. I also purchased the PS3 add-on so that I can use it to control DVDs through my PS3. If you're like me, and you have a whack of remotes on your coffee table, then I'd strongly recommend that you look at one of the Harmony remotes. I know that this one is the top-of-the-line which is why it is so pricey; it is now a few years old so I was hoping that the price would have dropped more...however even at this price it is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Blendama

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased several less expensive alternatives from other vendors. Those products were quite finicky and didn't always work the way you wanted them too. Given the lackluster performance of other products, I dropped the big cash on this product assuming paying for a brand name would make it better. Alternatively, the product is more finicky than the others...less reliable, and less flexible. And, because they are the brand to beat, they suffer from feature arrogance - do it our way, and we will not give you a lot of options.
customer_reviews.author: Nuclear Dad

customer_reviews.title: Solves the media equipment cupboard problem
customer_reviews.text: My wife hates having our media equipment out where it can be seen, so we have a pretty cupboard built in to the wall. Getting IR into that cupboard has been a pain. I've been using IR repeaters for years, and they've been inconsistent and slow. This remote completely solves the problem. Every click is "heard", and the equipment responds much faster than with the IR repeaters. One minor annoyance: if the cabinet doors are open, the two IR signals arriving via different paths confuse the equipment. With this repeater the doors must always be closed. (Which is the point anyway, I guess.)
customer_reviews.author: John Riedl

customer_reviews.title: Hi Tech Universal Remote
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote on the recommendation of the TV installation technicians. We wanted a wireless remote that would operate our components hidden in our cabinets. The technicians set up the remote and instructed us on its use. I think it would have been too complicated for myself or my husband to program ourselves, however. The initial use of the remote was a bit intimidating but we are now very comfortable with it. I did use the telephone help line for assistance with an issue and the technician was very helpful in talking me through the solution. Manufacturer assistance is available free for the first 90 days.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Received in poor condition
customer_reviews.text: Payed over a 100 dollars for item arrived used and also waited for 5 days to receive even though we are prime members. Yesterday finally received upon opening the unit had dry food particles all over it finger prints all over it . Disgusting was afraid to touch without gloves. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Redlion

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 900
customer_reviews.text: Mixed reviews, overall set-up was pretty easy and contolled all of my components and most of the functions. However with my Samsung 55" LED TV it does not do a good job in switching video sources, in fact, so far it has been unable to do so by iteself. I have to manually go into TV device and scroll, chose and enter source. Part of the problem is how Samsung set this up in their software, but for the money I would have thought the Logitech could have overcome it. SO not really using it and found my bose rV series emote to be more effective overall for all my sources
customer_reviews.author: Mat T

customer_reviews.title: Took a bit to get used to
customer_reviews.text: Have had the remote for about 6 months now. It took about 4 months to get used to it. We almost returned it. My son set it up for us, and until we understood exactly how it worked and not to shut anything off manually or make sure to point at the devices until everything has turned on/off. In the beginning our son had to reset the devices quite a few times, but the last couple of months we have not had any issues at all. Love the screen and it is so nice to only have one remote instead of four. Just don't let kids/guests use unless they understand how it works. Otherwise you have to reset devices.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMia

customer_reviews.title: This remote is Da Bomb! Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Ok ive had a logiteck master remote before bought about 10 years ago.And yes there kind pricy but omg anyone with multibale components and such its a MUST.Getr rid of having 5 remotes to screw around with.This baby does it all.... My older remote i had to replace batterys and as it got older after 10 years well i was spending alot on batterys thier costly...This bad boy has a liythiam battery and charging station!!! LOVE it Have to say the set up was a friggen BREEZE! Id give it a 10 star rating BUT only can post 5 Buy this you wont regret it
customer_reviews.author: remo

customer_reviews.title: OK but showing some problems
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several of the Logitech Harmony remotes in addition to this one. When these things work they are great. But beware that they stop working after 3-4 years. One of them the screen just stopped working, another couldn't be updated through its USB connection and another resulted in the remote just stopping. On this Logitech remote it is already showing signs of problems after 7 months. The screen will just go blank and I have to pull the batter. In addition, it will not hold the time. When you add up the cost of replacing the remotes it isn't worth the convenience that they offer.
customer_reviews.author: FlagGal

customer_reviews.title: Very good, but ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have an iMac computer, you may have a horrible time getting it synched up with this device, if you can do it at all. Calls to Logitech's help-desk get you to very sincere and nice people, but who, ultimately, can do nothing to fix this problem. Logitech is doing a great disservice to its customers by not taking immediate steps to overcome this problem. I ended up taking it to a friend with a PC to get it synched up, and for the most part, it works quite well now.
customer_reviews.author: EDH

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 900.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, is this thing capable. If you have the time and patience you can program this remote to do anything all your remotes do. I would give it 5 stars but my Panasonic Home Theater system throws it a curve that it is not able to cover. To watch TV the remote turns everything on correctly but after about a 20 - 25 second delay the home theater system changes the source over to the blue ray player. Pushing the help button on the remote corrects it though so it's not that big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: tsnrunningbare

customer_reviews.title: I know this this is obsolete now and I loved this remote while it worked
customer_reviews.text: I know this this is obsolete now and I loved this remote while it worked. I had it for a year and a half and then one day it just couldn't communicate with the blasters anymore. I tried to plug it into the computer and update the firmware or reset or really anything. It would communicate with the computer but it wouldn't update. It froze while attempting to do a firmware update. All in all I loved this remote but really think for the cost of it, it should have lasted for more than a year and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 900
customer_reviews.text: We have fallen in love with our Harmony. We are glad we upgraded to the infared model. A relative has the model without the infared and it does not work as easily as the Harmony 900. We do not have to worry where we point our remote, it works every time. The remote does just what it said it would do. It handles all our equipment, we do not have umpteen number of remotes setting around anymore. The biggest issue with the remote is the price!!! We figure if we use it 365 days a year it comes out to less than a dollar a day and it has alliviated a lot of frustration with finding the right remote.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it worked fine. It was a little slow
customer_reviews.text: Mine stopped working a week ago. Prior to that, it worked fine. It was a little slow, even after removing the device delays in the app. The touch screen was sensitive which led to errant commands being sent. I'm using a Harmony 650 as an interim remote until I find something to replace the 900. I will say that while the 650 is less expensive and not as visually impressive as the 900, it does the job and I don't miss the 900.
customer_reviews.author: H. Massey

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY remote I use!
customer_reviews.text: This review took me a while to write, because I wanted to see how reliable this unit was going to be. Well, it is hands down the BEST remote control I have ever owned and used! It controls everything and is easily customizable with the included software. I press the touch screen once to turn on my TV, Stereo and cable box. I do the same to watch a Blu-Ray, play a game on my WII or listen to my 200 CD carrousel. I don't own anything this remote can't control. Make some points with the hubby or boyfriend and buy him one of these babies!!!
customer_reviews.author: G. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and spent the money for a "universal remote" and I could not be happier! It truly eliminates the need for a remote for every device. Mapping it out is super easy (the directions make it so)...and the result is that you can ultimately do everything on this remote that you need to. For some of the more specific actions you do need to go through a few button pushes, but not having 5 remotes in the living room is so awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Bennett-Goulet

customer_reviews.title: Nice Remote
customer_reviews.text: I had the predecessor to this one the Harmony 810. In fact two of them. I have all my components behind a wall and inside cabinets so I needed the RF and IR function. Anyway, the upstairs remote was thrown into the washing machine.....don't ask. Looked for the Harmony 810. They don't make that one anymore. Upgraded to the Harmony 900. Easy to set up because the website has option for you to upgrade remotes and transfer all the data. Very sleek, fits well in the hand and works great! My wife wants to get another one for the one downstairs. Told her to throw that one in the washer then.
customer_reviews.author: Thinair720

customer_reviews.title: Logitech doesn't even want this one anymore.  Mac users beware!
customer_reviews.text: NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MAC OS X!!!!! I bought this a couple years ago and it has worked find. I recently updated my desktop to a newer operating system and find that I'm no longer able to connect with the remote, nor has Logitech offered any update. There are several lame posts in their forum about attempting to address this problem but the are dated. I'm surprised to see this still for sale on Amazon as it's clear that Logitech is no longer interested in supporting it. Very disappointing that you can spend several hundred dollars on a remote and have the company abandon it so quickly. I'll be looking for another brand of universal remote to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Gouty Viking

customer_reviews.title: Worst remote I ever had nothing but problems
customer_reviews.text: Bought this remote FEB 2013 I had had nothing but problems . Have to get up and go to chenge chanels turn off Tv sound never worked continualy for more then two days . Now it does not work at all tried getting a new battery. new charger nothing worked. I would never buy this product again. Sold by Amizone I tried to contact them it said warranty expired March 2013 only 60 days for a $400 Remote. I buy every thing though Amazon very disapionted on this purchse and no responce from Amizone
customer_reviews.author: Shiplama

customer_reviews.title: A Remote That's Almost There
customer_reviews.text: This universal remote has tremendous possibilities. I like that it can ape individual remotes. It can set up devices based on how you view or listen to your entertainment systems. The biggest problems are that it does not hold the settings and you frequently need to go through guided help on the remote to fix the issue. Easy as that is, it is a nuisance. Also, the RF does not always fire at the blasters and it get bothersome to skip through the DVR, or adjust volume, change tv screens, etc. Again, not a big issue, but for $300 to $400, these should not be issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Steve N.

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Universal User
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as replacement for exact same model, and are disappointed in the difference in quality betweent the original unit, purchased 1 year earlier. Again, same model, but different quality. This new remote has intermittent screen viewing (often is simply blank) and shuts off on occassion. If I had purchased this one initially, I would not have bought a 2nd one. We were thinking to buy same for our other TV/bluray/DVR, but will not based on our current experience.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: VERY SHORT RF RANGE
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely disappointed in this device. The RF range was barely 20 ft in a normal house environment. Logitech is completely unresponsive. If you want to be able to control your home TV from another room, this device is not the answer. They claim they tested it for 100' but that was line-of-sight in an open room. Hell, you could do that with an IR-only device. Since receivers are very simple, it means they scrimped on the power of the transmitter - probably to extend battery life. It is much simpler to program than other remotes and has a vast library of supported TV, amplifiers, etc. VERY disappointing..
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a Harmony One for three years and LOVE IT! Went to order another one and found out they no longer make them. I ordered a 900 since it's so similar with the only difference being the red, green, blue, and yellow buttons. The seller was great and it arrived a day early. The only reason I didn't give this remote five stars was because it came with a install disc that was outdated. Once I downloaded the current software from Logitech's website, set-up went well and I'm now loving the 900 too!
customer_reviews.author: Busy Bee

customer_reviews.title: If you have the latest version of MAC OS, DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: After 12 hours, 3 phone calls to tech Logitech tech support, I was finally advised send it back. MAC OS LION not support by Logitech. I even called Logitech sales before I made my purchase and was assured by the sales person the 900 was supported by MAC OS. I have 5 devices I wanted to co-exist and it never happened. Thank you Logitech tech support for being up front and honest, I give them 5 stars. Sales in the United States 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: njrcs

customer_reviews.title: Hubby picked this one out for us
customer_reviews.text: Once programmed (takes a bit of knowhow), it is very easy to use for the average person used to everyday technology (i.e. my 90 year old grandmother could never figure it out, but we bought an identical one for my 65 year-old parents, and they can use it fine). Is it perfect? No. It still takes some learning on the part of the user; but few pieces of technology designed today are completely intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Traecy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the grandparents and I would buy one for myself too!
customer_reviews.text: I set this up for my grandparents and they LOVE IT! It's the only remote i could find that has a touch screen and a number pad. I paired the RF hub with 2x 2.5mm mono (male) to 3.5mm mono (female) adapter and 2x 3 IR sticky emitter cables to insure every device works EVERY time.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Good but is not worth that price
customer_reviews.text: It does work. I wish there was a way to name your customized activities instead of a generic name which just add a number at the end. Or is there? However, no matter how good this remote could be, and it is not that good, it is not worth over $200. Paying $280 for a remote control that does not make you coffee is completely insane. I would like to buy two more for my bedrooms but I will not pay that price, ever again. This remote is well worth about $150.
customer_reviews.author: J. F. J.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up, works great with radio frequency booster, and inside cabinet IR!!
customer_reviews.text: All of our components are hidden behind a wall and the radio frequency booster performs flawlessly. We run 4 devices off this remote: flat-screen tv, tuner, blue-ray, and cable box. Set up was super easy, less than 45 minutes. The set up wizard was a lot easier than entering codes, but the best part - NO batteries!!! It's rechargeable and a charge last about a week. Highly recommended!!!!
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: I am deceived - used item was sold as NEW
customer_reviews.text: The product has been sold to me as Brand New. However after the purchase, Seller "Sporty Deals" revealed in the invoice that the product is "like" brand new but in fact an Open Box item. There is no manufacturer warranty it carries. There has been a continuous operational problems - remote crashing often - responding slow and battery draining within 2-3 days with very nominal use. Now in less than 6 months the battery has gone completely dead. I purchased the item from Amazon and now using in India, where it would have got covered under International Warranty, as Logitech provides support in India, had it been a brand new product as advertised. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rajeev

customer_reviews.title: Awesome remote
customer_reviews.text: As long as you spend the time to get it all set up correctly, you'll love this remote. Love the touch screen, big fan of the logitech remotes. I was going to get the big square one (forget the model), because it "seemed cool" and lets face it, anyone who has a big square tablet remote is probably loaded right? Then I read the reviews and didn't. I went instead with this one and am much better for it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Better by far than the Harmony 1100
customer_reviews.text: Its not perfect. Buttons are slippery (but lighted) and so is the remote with the exception of the rubber coated part. RF control unit (included) works better than the expensive unit I purchased for my 1100 (for sale). I am pleased with the basic functions, set-up was easy and the charging cradle is impressive. My only concern is how long the battery will last. As with anything well made it needs to be handled with care and kept away from the two year olds in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Beneke

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: This effectively replaced 7 remotes in a home entertainment system that were driving my wife nuts. There are a couple of things that this does not do such as allow you to record a show on TV while you are watching it, it is expensive and I am a little concerned that Logitech has discontinued it but it is better than having to sort through 7 remotes to do anything. My wife who is nontechnical loves it.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: The nearly perfect tool!
customer_reviews.text: I guess if our home theater setup weren't so complex, I'd have given this a perfect score, but I really did need help programming it. That said, it is WONDERFUL! With simple clicks, we can watch TV, listen to the radio, play a cassette tape, watch a VHS tape or DVD, and even use the TV as my laptop's monitor. Logitech's tech support even programmed parts of it for me during the 30-day free support period. Cannot rave highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Raina

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you are a Mac user
customer_reviews.text: Logitech has essentially zero support for Mac even though it says the product is compatible. However, Google searches will show this not the case. You have to apparently set numerous to get it to work -- which it never did for me. It just hangs in the "connect to the computer via USB cable or wake it up". Upgraded my OS to 10.8 and it still won't work. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Good, but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift for Christmas 2010. In April 2013, it started to die and has been struggling ever since. Quote from support "Based on the information and troubleshooting steps done this is a sign of a broken remote that might have exhausted its remaining life" - and that life is somewhere around 3.5 years. It was great up until that point, though.One day it just started showing an all white LCD and I continually had to remove the battery to 'reboot' the remote. Logitech support can help with starting it in safe mode and upgrading the firmware, but if the problem returns, its a good sign the product is end of life.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: This replaces a Harmony 1000 that was a virtual paperweight. It set up easy and after a few tweaks runs my system perfectly. It does suck that you can't do macros, but I knew that coming into it so I can't complain. I just needed a remote that could be used by anyone to get my TV, Receiver, Blu-Ray and DVD changer to work together... and it does that flawlessly. No missed signals and just a few tweaks on delays and it works 100% of the time. It's also very easy to switch to run individual components. All in all, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Amused

customer_reviews.title: Wish I still had my old one!
customer_reviews.text: My old remote was great. But after many years and drops by the kids, it died. I thought this would be an upgrade, but it was not. It worked great for a while, but those days are over. I don't know when it will or won't work. It is frequently dead. Luckily, if I pop the battery out for a while, it will reboot. But that's a pain. Looking for a new RF remote. This one stinks.
customer_reviews.author: California

customer_reviews.title: 900 Harmony - nice but the Apple interface is a challenge
customer_reviews.text: The software is not capatable with Apple's Lion operating system... While they have a temporary fix - it doesn't make for any easy start-up. The Tech Support is not familiar with what needs to be done if you have an Apple product....also it took me more than an 1 hour and 45 minutes just to get through to them...NOT GOOD. The remote works good and is easy to use once you get the software to work.
customer_reviews.author: Frank R. Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: I love how it can easily control all my devices and I don't need to point it at the TV anymore. It still works a good 40 feet away. The touch screen is really nice, but sometimes my family accidentally touches it and turns off a movie or something. That can be frustrating. Set up was pretty easy. The computer software could be better, but it does work. I'm still very pleased that I got it. The help button is actually really useful.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Benteman

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Once its setup..but the setup can be a hassle( frequently looses connection and might be time consuming with firmware update/software update). Wish it had a feedback loop on the state of the controlled devices! to avoid frequently using the Help guide. But it seems to be the best available, not necessarily the perfect soln. the remote itself is great..its the firmware ,I guess.
customer_reviews.author: tv

customer_reviews.title: Battery Cannot Be Replaced - Renders Device Useless
customer_reviews.text: In little more than a year the battery needed replacing. Unfortunately the engineers (?) at Logitech didn't take into consideration that batteries swell as they age. My battery cannot be removed, it's permanently lodged inside the remove, so the device is now useless. How can an experienced manufacturer make a novice mistake like this? Inexcusable.
customer_reviews.author: Enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS REMOTE!
customer_reviews.text: We love having one remote for all our digital entertainment needs! We have a dvd, a Bose sound system, and our flat screen television. Imagine all those separate remotes! So, it is great having one remote and love the touch screen! Also love the help option in case there are things that don't turn on all at the same time! Saves troubleshooting!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Sape

customer_reviews.title: ARTHUR @ LOGITECH WAS 10 STAR CUSTOMER SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: I do believe INSTRUCTIONS should be included with logitech 900 or at least a cs number so out of the box one can beam up the remote .... However once one figures out where to call the set up is a breeze and customer service is 10 star .... we have a home theater projector ,receiver apple tv sony dvd and sony cd player as well as u verse box and a second audio receiver ALL BEAMED UP QUITE EASILY AND UNLIKE PAST ISSUES WHEN USING A MAC ~~~~~LOGITECH SYNC- UP TO OUR MAC WITH EASE ... BRAVO
customer_reviews.author: Frank R Linet

customer_reviews.title: I am giving it a 4 because 1. You ...
customer_reviews.text: I am giving it a 4 because 1. You cannot define custom activities. 2.You cannot change the order of task in a activity at all. ( Here is what I mean, I have a Samsung TV and a Sony Projector, software is programming Watch TV activity and turning on my TV and Projector and there is not option to remove TV from the activity)
customer_reviews.author: Prashanth R.

customer_reviews.title: Do more research before buying another
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of money Logitech charges for these remotes, they should last longer. This is my 2nd Harmony remote in 10 years (will be looking for a new remote soon) - I live alone and do not have kids playing with the remot,e, so it is treated well, but for some reason buttons just stop working after a few years. Its irritating.
customer_reviews.author: PunkInParkZoo

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 900
customer_reviews.text: Great product! A little expensive for a remote but it does what it claims to do with perfection. Very easy to set up and use. The best universal remote I've ever had and the fact that it allowed me to hide all the messy components associated with the TV made the wife happy. I don't know how this compares with the cheap competitor model out there, but Logitech has a good family of products, so if you don't mind the expense...go for it!
customer_reviews.author: rpj

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Support.
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to set up. I got the TV, Blueray, and Amplifier set right, but needed help setting up my Dish network. Just to say, there is an setting that has to change in the dish setup to make it right. It was not compatable with my lighting or cooling/heating sytems. But otherwise it is very easy to use. You just push on the screen what you want to use and it does the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Fulton

customer_reviews.title: Not For The Faint of Heart
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to my technical "arsenal". This item continues to interest me in it's wide range of configuration possibilities. It has indeed allowed improvement over using seven other remotes. It does however, demand much reading of instructional material which is available only "on line" and thus requires either more costly but more convenient print out. The need for a Technical Manual accompaniment becomes obvious early in the setup process. I would imagine this item to disappoint those expecting a fast, easy, simple solution to their "too many remotes" woes.
customer_reviews.author: Vanton

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Has a few glitches
customer_reviews.text: I love having all my devices tuned to the same remote. It sometimes acts strangely and i have to put in back in the charger or take the battery out . It happens about once a month. It worries me that it'll break but I did just receive a firmware update that says it has "bug fixes". I still love it though. I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: BK
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding Product! Love it!! BUT, customer service Sucks! I tried calling the help number and got the indefinate hold music. Tried it a couple of times for 15 minutes or more and had to hang up. Then I tried the on-line e-mail support. Sent my question about a small problem I was having with the software on my computer. The message said thanks for the e-mail and someone would respond within 24 hours with a response. It's been five days now - nothing. Great product but obviously Logitech doesn't care about its customers, just your $$.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: My home theater system IR control through a universal remote system was not predictably controlled. I found myself intermittently using the individual component remotes to compensate. Also, my AV receiver was in a closet behind my plasma tv. I give the Harmony 900 5 stars for its unbelievably perfect for the consistent and sensitive control of my system. Honestly, the setup was a bear. I followed the computer software instructions, the troubleshooting section on the website, but finally spent an hour and a half with a support technician who ultimately got it working the way it was intended. Sort of like childbirth. You forget the painful delivery once the baby arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Stan Yeatts

customer_reviews.title: needs technician to program
customer_reviews.text: good product , but required a AV technician to set up. so add a service call to the price( $90) unless you are tech savvy
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 remotes, 1 worked, 1 didn't. Sent it back and STILL waiting to receive new one! Said they had to see if it truly is defective! Logitech person told us it was bad and that's why we knew it was defective! Forget paying the 1-3 day shipping! You won't get it that soon! We will not order from this company again!
customer_reviews.author: nana

customer_reviews.title: L-o-v-e I-t!
customer_reviews.text: This remote works beautifully. The operation is smooth and the configuration is simple. The RF capability is very nice - most of my components are hidden, which is nice. I own the Harmony 880 as well, but its getting pretty old and I have to push the buttons extra hard to ensure the key press is registered. I still use it, however, with another system. I'm considering buying a second Harmony 900 for that system. Cons - the price!
customer_reviews.author: Super T

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 900
customer_reviews.text: Excellent functionality. Set up is pretty straight forward with a little fine tuning needed. Love that it turns on and off all devices with one button. Not the easiest to navigate with thumb if not looking at remote, but I am transitioning from the Almighty Tivo peanut remote! Buttons are not "soft" ... requiring a harder push. Lastly, something is rattling inside (not a snake), but it works fine for now. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: DroboJoe

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive, but very capable remote.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to combine remotes, but it is expensive! I recommend the one of the other, less expensive Harmony remotes if you can get away with it. I needed this because of the RF capability. I do not have line of sight to my devices, this remote allows me to keep my living room free of electronic clutter.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas C

customer_reviews.title: Expect better but prepare for disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Worked great until it was out of warranty then became unusable - blank screen/would not connect for software update. Customer support helped troubleshoot but declared it a hardware problem. Of course the solution was to buy a new one - no repair or refurbish option.. For this price for a top of the line product you'd expect a lot better. Avoid or run the risk.
customer_reviews.author: golf six

customer_reviews.title: Remote does the job, but...
customer_reviews.text: Happy enough with the remote. When it works, it works well. Moving through menus is a bit slow. Main problem is with the RF. Never works 100%. Bought a second remote (first one died after a couple of years - screen was going weird) so ended up with second base station + receivers. Set both base stations/receivers up so would have coverage across the width of the cabinet where all my gear is stored. Thought this might resolve issues where RF would fail (cross symbol shown on remote) but still get the odd failure... Would have gone with another option if I hadn't spent ages getting it working with my MediaPortal installation.
customer_reviews.author: jazzydnb

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I only have to say good things about the Harmony 900, was using my Philips Pronto TSU7000 for seven (7) years and it was time for an upgrade. I have to say that I'm impressed of this remote in a very positive way; setup was very easy to understand and went flawless. This remote exceeded my expectations and I'm a happy camper now.
customer_reviews.author: S+S Florida

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This remote is awesome, only reason I ended up getting rid of it was for a smaller form factor.
customer_reviews.author: Glack

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: The remote worked like a charm and replaced all my remotes. I ran into problems when connecting its software on my Mac. It just doesn't like Mac and Logitech seems not interested in sorting the issue out. Either that or they have no clue how to you Mac themselves. If you have a Bose system, don't get this as you will find a few functions not working.
customer_reviews.author: Almalood

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Harmony 900 is Great
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an Omega remote with a Harmony 900, & it was a great decision that I wished I had done sooner. The setup was a little tricky and I had to call Tech Support to help program it. Tech Support was great...got me going in less than 15 minutes & all of the components of my home theater were fully programmed for immediate use. I have not had to modify the program since the initial setup. I've used the remote for a month & have found it to be well designed, user friendly, and reliable. It's nice to be completely satisfied with a purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E. Schnee

customer_reviews.title: If you actually get it working, it's great.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Mac and PC. I have gotten it to sync up once. Over the past 6 months, once. Mac or PC. Once... It was enough to put on the activities that I wanted, but I can't update any of it. The clock on the remote is several hours off, but I can't fix it. If I had the money, I'd buy a different remote, but I don't so I am stuck with this. Don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: wpds

customer_reviews.title: Defective motion sensor
customer_reviews.text: As designed, the remote is supposed to wake up when it moved (motion sensor). Unfortunately, this feature works very poorly. When new, sometimes it wakes up if you shake it - but after a few months even this stopped working. I ordered a replacement from Logitech but the replacement unit works exactly the same way. Other than this one feature, product works well, although it is quite expensive for a remote control.
customer_reviews.author: DavidA

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a replacement remote for an older model Logitech remote. Surprised my Valentine with this upgraded model. Works with the old bluetooth accessory he had purchased for his old Logitech to make the remote compatible with the PS3. Very nice sleek design and very nice recharging feature!
customer_reviews.author: Henri

customer_reviews.title: Great remote. Makes your life easier.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Very easy to program. I use mine to control a/v gear in a closet using the r/f feature and a Logitech ps3 adapter. Will occasionally show a white screen, which is a glitch fixed by placing it on the charger. Very intuitive remote. Great value for money in a r/f solution.
customer_reviews.author: chris gates

customer_reviews.title: Great seller
customer_reviews.text: My father in law had one of these for years and finally broke it. When I found this I had to get it for him and it came in perfect condition and made his day. Thanks so much 🙏
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great remote but still a little pricey
customer_reviews.text: This remote worked just as advertised. We are using the remote to control all our gear located in a hall closet. It works flawlessly, but you have to be careful when using the volume. You have to click the volume one click at a time, otherwise volume will jump way up. We have an Onkyo AV receiver, Motorola set top box, Samsung Blue Ray player and a Samsung TV. All devices turn on and off perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: aceman

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This remote is awesome!!!! We recently invested in a 60" flatscreen, that we wanted to mount on a wall. Having this remote, our wall looks so wire free, and clean! Our cable box, and other electronics, are nice and neat in a nearby closet. This remote is so easy to program, and use!! We are very happy with this remote!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Terrible RF
customer_reviews.text: First off, I would like to say that I use to rave about Harmony remotes and there customer support.... Now not so much. The remote looks good and feels good in your hand. Functionality is pretty good when you are using it as a stand alone remote with IR. However, the RF portion didn't go any further than 15'-20' tops. That being said, customer support wanted to give any excuse in the book why the RF signal was intermittent to none, including "cordless phones, baby monitors, wireless routers and even treadmills". I hope that this will save you some of the headache that I had. Not to mention the 4hrs on the phone with their "wonderful" customer support.
customer_reviews.author: A/V installer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine until the last drop. Now it barely even turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Lukeluc04

customer_reviews.title: If considering the 900, DON'T
customer_reviews.text: When my 890 died it seemed logical to buy another Harmony. I purchased the 900 because I needed RF because my electronics are in a cabinet. After two calls and three hours with support, I was told to just leave the cabinet doors open. The IR works great. The RF is unreliable and requires that you manually start some componants. The blasters just aren't as good as the old blasters. I sent this one back and found another 890.
customer_reviews.author: Sullair

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from Harmony 890
customer_reviews.text: Great remote...I upgraded from the 890 and couldn't be happier. I'm glad to get rid of the IR emitters for the IR blasters....and only having to program the remote as opposed to the remote AND emitter. Programming was very easy, and this remote has a very nice form factor. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Just replaced my URC MX-600 with the Harmony 900 and love it! The touch screen capability is wonderful and the activities are easy to set up. I had macros on the MX-600 which are compared to the activities on the 900. Everyone was bashing Harmony for not having macros which I don't understand why after having both brands.
customer_reviews.author: D. WOOD

customer_reviews.title: Defective right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this remote after my seven year old Harmony 890 died with the expectation that it would be another well designed and manufactured product. However, as soon as I began the set up, the remote would not communicate with the Harmony software. After spending 20 minutes with tech support, the Harmony rep declared that the unit was defective and would need to be returned. He also indicated that units purchased through Amazon had a higher failure rate than units at a brick and mortar store - very disappointing. I have returned the remote for a refund and will be buying a replacement at Best Buy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Christenson

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one month past the one year warranty!*$*%&@
customer_reviews.text: Remote died one month after the warranty is over. Logitech customer support said that I may have left it in the charger too long which kills the memory chip. Really, their charger kills the memory chip if I leave it in the charger over night! Bad. DON'T BUY IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have Harmony Remotes on all my TV's. eliminates (4) different Remotes
customer_reviews.author: Cinch

customer_reviews.title: The simplicity I wanted
customer_reviews.text: The product was easy to setup, the RF singling is responsive and the library of devices it supports is impressive. It's the best money I've spent in enhancing my home theater experience so far. If the price isn't an issue and you don't have time to play with configuring a remote, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: Now that Logitech replaced a faulty one, it is a great remote.
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews and blogs that I've come across, there was a bad batch of Harmony 900s sold where the RF signal worked very sporadically. It took me several frustrating weeks with Logitech support as I slowly moved up the "food-chain" within their support department. However, Logitech finally agreed to ship me a new unit with a return UPS label for the old unit. I think they finally have a handle on the problem and the new remote works great. I also have a Harmony One and have had zero issues with it. Neither are 100% perfect in every way possible but they both do a very fine job. Even my technology-averse in-laws can work both remotes.
customer_reviews.author: L. E. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Setup required, but not always possible
customer_reviews.text: The remote must connect to (...) to be set up, but the connection to that site is rather flaky, slow, and sometimes nonexistent. I have to add---it's also very painful because it times out and I have to log in again in the middle of setup.
customer_reviews.author: Todd D. Vance

customer_reviews.title: Great remote
customer_reviews.text: Great remote. This is my second Harmony. Easy to set up, everything works as advertised. Sometimes get some delay when using RF, though this may be related to the placement of the IR transmitter. The unit is well made. Expensive, but cheap compared to other high end remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: YES YES
customer_reviews.text: TOOK A MINUTE TO SET UP TO ALL MY DEVICES BUT AFTER THE INITIAL SET UP WORKED AWESOME! HAD IT A LITTLE OVER A MONTH NOW AND NO COMPLAINTS AT ALL. JUST STILL HAVE TO GET THE BLASTER FOR MY PLAYSTATION AND WILL CONTROL EVERY DEVICE IN MY HOUSE. VERY SATISFIED! A NEW MUST HAVE.
customer_reviews.author: JWOW

customer_reviews.title: Best harmony remote
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this I was replacing a harmony 880. Having the rf control really makes life easier. I think this is even better than the current Harry remotes as far as how well it fits your hand. If you are in the market for a remote, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product based on the reviews and unfortunately I have had a horrible experience. The remote did not work correctly from the first day we received it. I tried to return it and they will not return the item, nor will they even replace the remote. It is extremely too expensive for them not to replace or return the item if it doesn't work. Buyers beware.
customer_reviews.author: Savina

customer_reviews.title: Spend extra and get a better true universal remote
customer_reviews.text: Hard to program and must hit a lot of buttons to use various zones/modes . Spend extra and get a better true universal remote
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stewart
customer_reviews.text: This unit is so easy to program and can run any units attached to your TV. It has such an amazing assortment of easy programable features that you won't have to use your remote control units. Logitech backs their product with great service and if you have a problem they are a phone call away.
customer_reviews.author: stewart

customer_reviews.title: First year it worked fine, now it is dead
customer_reviews.text: First year it worked fine, now it is dead. I have tried to power it up without success. Tried thru firmware update, replace battery, push, pull, roll and pray... and guess what? dead. I became suprised again when searching for serial number printed on the remote control - nothing. Amazon sent a remote control without serial number. Dead end.
customer_reviews.author: Ale!_BR

customer_reviews.title: very happy with Harmony 900
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a $3000 RCI remote. it broke every year. it costs $1000 to replace just the remote with them and their customer service is nil. with the Harmony everything is easy, and everything works. happy with it. Harmony is a much better than the RCI remote
customer_reviews.author: jerrymarin

customer_reviews.title: the best that their is.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great universal remote. I bought it for a client. The client is NOT a tech genius. This remote was easily able to replace all of his remotes with one. The charging cradle is excellent and can displayed anuwhere.
customer_reviews.author: Zeus

product_meta.title: Logitech Harmony 900 Rechargeable Remote with Color Touch Screen (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Logitech Harmony 900 lets you put your home-entertainment equipment behind walls or cabinet doors using RF (radio frequency) technology. Just place the simple-to-install IR blaster and mini blasters near the equipment you want to control to turn RF signals into IR commands your devices understand. Once you're set up, the full-color touch screen lets you see only the controls you need and start your entertainment with just one touch. You can replace up to 15 other remotes. And our software finds the control codes for your equipment from our online database of more than 5,000 brands and 225,000 devices.
